title: To a False Friend.
content: Our hands have met, but not our hearts; Our hands will never meet again. Friends, if we have ever been, Friends we cannot now remain: I only know I loved you once, I only know I loved in vain; Our hands have met, but not our hearts; Our hands will never meet again! Then farewell to heart and hand! I would our hands had never met: Even the outward form of love Must be resign’d with some regret. Friends, we still might seem to be, If I my wrong could e’er forget; Our hands have join’d but not our hearts: I would our hands had never met!
